documentation.text: @dev Only pool admin can call functions marked by this modifier.
@dev Only pool can call functions marked by this modifier.

@inheritdoc IERC20Detailed
@inheritdoc IERC20Detailed
@inheritdoc IERC20
@inheritdoc IERC20

@notice Returns the address of the Incentives Controller contract
 @return The address of the Incentives Controller

@notice Sets a new Incentives Controller
 @param controller the new Incentives controller
@inheritdoc IERC20
@inheritdoc IERC20
@inheritdoc IERC20
@inheritdoc IERC20

@notice Update the name of the token
 @param newName The new name for the token

@notice Update the symbol for the token
 @param newSymbol The new symbol for the token

@notice Update the number of decimals for the token
 @param newDecimals The new number of decimals for the token

devdoc.author: Aave, inspired by the Openzeppelin ERC20 implementation

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729 Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.

params.decimals: The number of decimals of the token
params.name: The name of the token
params.pool: The reference to the main Pool contract

params.spender: The user allowed to spend on behalf of _msgSender()
params.subtractedValue: The amount being subtracted to the allowance

returns._0: The address of the Incentives Controller

params.addedValue: The amount being added to the allowance
params.spender: The user allowed to spend on behalf of _msgSender()

totalSupply().details: Returns the amount of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

devdoc.title: IncentivizedERC20

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Decreases the allowance of spender to spend _msgSender() tokens

getIncentivesController().notice: Returns the address of the Incentives Controller contract

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Increases the allowance of spender to spend _msgSender() tokens
